de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.grammar.productions
Class ExpressionImpl

java.lang.Object
  de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.grammar.productions.ExpressionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpression
Direct Known Subclasses:
AKOExpression, Anchor, AssociationPattern, BindingSet, BooleanExpression, BooleanExpression, BooleanFilter, BooleanPrimitive, ComparisonExpression, Content, Content, DeleteClause, DeleteExpression, Directive, EnvironmentClause, EnvironmentClause, ExistsClause, ExistsQuantifiers, Expression, Filter, FilterPostfix, FlwrExpression, ForAllClause, ForClause, FromClause, FunctionCall, FunctionInvocation, InsertClause, InsertExpression, ISAExpression, LimitClause, Literal, MergeExpression, Navigation, NonInterpretedContent, NonInterpretedContent, NumericalExpression, OffsetClause, OrderByClause, OrderByClause, ParameterPair, Parameters, PathExpression, PathExpression, PathSpecification, PathStep, Postfix, PostfixedExpression, Pragma, Pragma, PredicateInvocation, PredicateInvocationRolePlayerExpression, PrefixDirective, PrefixDirective, ProjectionPostfix, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, ReturnClause, ScopeFilter, SelectClause, SelectExpression, SetExpression, SimpleContent, SimpleExpression, Step, TMContent, TMContent, TopicDefinition, TupleExpression, UpdateClause, UpdateExpression, ValueExpression, ValueExpression, Variable, Variable, VariableAssignment, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, XMLContent
public abstract class ExpressionImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpression

Base implementation of IExpression representing one specific production rule of the TMQL language draft. The expression also represent one node of the parsing-tree generated by the parser instance. The instance encapsulates all tokens containing to the production rule, all variables and provide utility functions to access information.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Constructor Detail

ExpressionImpl

public ExpressionImpl(IExpression parent,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends IToken>> tmqlTokens,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens,
                      ITMQLRuntime runtime)
               throws TMQLInvalidSyntaxException,
                      TMQLGeneratorException
base constructor to create a new expression without sub-nodes

Parameters:
parent - the known parent node
tmqlTokens - the list of language-specific tokens contained by this expression
tokens - the list of string-represented tokens contained by this expression
runtime - the TMQL runtime
Throws:
TMQLInvalidSyntaxException - thrown if the syntax of the given sub-query is invalid
TMQLGeneratorException - thrown if the sub-tree can not be generated
Method Detail

addExpression

public final void addExpression(IExpression ex)
Method add a new sub-tree to the production rule. The method normally calls during the initialization process of the production itself and during the parsing process. The method add a new sub-expression to the internal list.

Specified by:
addExpression in interface IExpression
Parameters:
ex - the new expression to add

getExpressions

public java.util.List<IExpression> getExpressions()
Method returns a list of all contained expression. Contained expressions will production rules which are part of the represented rule and interpreted as children nodes or leafs of the parsing tree.

Specified by:
getExpressions in interface IExpression
Returns:
the list of contained expression

getTmqlTokens

public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends IToken>> getTmqlTokens()
Method returns a list of language-specific tokens as a sub-set of the tokens generated by the lexical scanner. The list of tokens represent the whole sub-query of this production rule.

Specified by:
getTmqlTokens in interface IExpression
Returns:
a list of language-specific tokens

getTokens

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens()
Method returns a list of string-represented tokens as a sub-set of the tokens generated by the lexical scanner. The list of tokens represent the whole sub-query of this production rule.

Specified by:
getTokens in interface IExpression
Returns:
a list of string-represented tokens

getGrammarType

public int getGrammarType()
In the current draft some production rules support different syntactical patterns and can be differ in grammar levels. The method return an identifier representing the grammar type at the context of the production rule.

Specified by:
getGrammarType in interface IExpression
Returns:
a numeric value representing the grammar type

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

getParent

public IExpression getParent()
Method returns the current parent node as part of the parsing tree. The parent instance will be set by calling the constructor and represent the production rule containing the expression represented by this instance.

Specified by:
getParent in interface IExpression
Returns:
the parent expression. Please note that an instance of query-expression can return null if it is root-node of parsing tree.

setGrammarType

public void setGrammarType(int type)
In the current draft some production rules support different syntactical patterns and can be differ in grammar levels. The method set the grammar type to the given numeric value.

Specified by:
setGrammarType in interface IExpression
Parameters:
type - a numeric value representing the grammar type

isValid

public abstract boolean isValid()
Method checks if the current expression is valid in context of the current TMQL draft and their extensions.

Returns:
true if the expression is valid, false otherwise.

getExpressionFilteredByType

public <T extends IExpression> java.util.List<T> getExpressionFilteredByType(java.lang.Class<? extends T> type)
Method returns a sub-list of contained production rules filtered by a type. The type symbolize the production rule type the caller is interested in. Please note that at least an empty list will be returned and at most the result is equal to the method IExpression.getExpressions().

Specified by:
getExpressionFilteredByType in interface IExpression
Type Parameters:
T - the type parameter of expressions the caller is interested in
Parameters:
type - the type of expressions the caller is interested in
Returns:
a list of expressions of the given type which are included by the current instance

getRuntime

public ITMQLRuntime getRuntime()

getVariables

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVariables()
Method extract all language-specific tokens which represents a variable token and transform them to their string-represented pattern.

Specified by:
getVariables in interface IExpression
Returns:
a list of all variables contained in the production rule

setExpressions

public final void setExpressions(java.util.List<IExpression> reorder)
                          throws TMQLRuntimeException
During the optimization process the contained expressions can be reorder by setting a new list of expression, which has to contain the same expressions like the old one but can be differ in order. Please note that this method can cause serious errors, if the re-ordered list contains absurd content.

Specified by:
setExpressions in interface IExpression
Parameters:
reorder - the new order of contained expression
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if the given list does not contain the same elements like the old one

checkForExtensions

public void checkForExtensions(java.lang.Class<? extends IExpression> clazz,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends IToken>> tmqlTokens,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens,
                               ITMQLRuntime runtime)
                        throws TMQLInvalidSyntaxException,
                               TMQLGeneratorException
Method checks if there is an extension for the given expression type. If not the expression of this type will be created.

Specified by:
checkForExtensions in interface IExpression
Parameters:
clazz - the expression type
tmqlTokens - the language-specific tokens
tokens - the string-represented tokens
runtime - the runtime
Throws:
TMQLInvalidSyntaxException - thrown by constructor
TMQLGeneratorException - thrown by constructor

isChildOf

public boolean isChildOf(java.lang.Class<? extends IExpression> clazz)
Method checks if the current expression is a child of the specified expression type. The method walks up to the tree root and check all parent types.

Specified by:
isChildOf in interface IExpression
Parameters:
clazz - the expression type
Returns:
true if the current expression is a child of the specified type, false otherwise.

                              IContext context,
                              java.lang.Object... optionalArguments)
                       throws TMQLRuntimeException

Specified by:
interpret in interface IExpression
Parameters:

context - the context
optionalArguments - any optional arguments
Returns:
the matches for this expression
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if querying fails
